item.description: ElementO was designed as a learning tool for the Periodic Table of Elements. Players acquire elements by landing on them. When another player lands on an element, which is owed, they must pay the owner protons. The last player with protons wins. This game is a scientific variant of Monopoly. If you are into science, teaching or the Periodic Table of Elements this game is for you. The game board depicts the Periodic Table of Elements.

In a dark age, in a forgotten time, there is a world called Scar. Here, fighters are forced to do battle for the amusement of an evil warlord named Xar. Only a Fistful of Power can destroy him. It's up to you to build an army and throw down the challenge, before all is lost.

This is a ultra-low skill dice-rolling game where the miniatures themselves are rolled. (similar to Pass the Pigs, but much simpler.) Simply throw the figures on the table, and count the point values (printed on the sole of the figures' feet) of the ones that landed face up.

item.description:
The Barbie Sparkle Kingdom game is very much like a Barbie themed Candyland. Rather than drawing cards with colors on them, the player spins a spinner, chooses a flower on the spinner, looks under the flower for the color and moves their piece to the next space on the board of that color. If that space has a flower, the player gets another turn. If the player lands on a bumble bee, they have to go back to the spot of the previous bumble bee on the board. There are short cuts (Rainbow Bridge, Butterfly Trail, Crystal Path) to speed you along your route. The winner is the player to be the first to Barbie's Jeweled Palace.

Components:
1 glittery game board
4 Barbie playing pieces
1 flower spinner with base
5 plastic flowers
50 glittery stickers
1 spinner and playing piece label sheet
Instructions

name.value: The Original Fortune Telling Board Game

item.description:
From the back of the box:

"The Original Fortune Telling Board Game " by Jennifer Sands is the only board game of its kind that combines a fun and safe methodology based on modern fortune card readings and empowered by real mystical stones. With a roll of the dice each player is whisked away on a journey to discover his or her special personalized fortune. Collect, win, lose or buy LOVE, MONEY, PEOPLE and Question cards in this fun and exciting game where all players win a real personalized fortune card reading of their own.

---

Each player rolls the die, moves his or her pawn, and then does what the landed on square tells them to. This is almost always either gaining or losing fortune telling cards (from four different decks - love, money, people, and questions) or empowering stones (which can be traded in for fortune telling cards). The rules state that the "object is for each player to collect as many fortune telling cards as possible"; but they also state that the winner "is the player who draws the last card," which ends the game and allows that player to discard up to three of their cards.

The real purpose is for each player to use the cards collected during the game to have their personal fortune told on the tarot-style card layout board.

If you believe in this stuff, you'll be happy to know that "all Jennifer Sands products are created with the assistance of professional psychics, fortune tellers and astrologers. All Jennifer Sands products use safe fortune telling methodologies."

If you don't believe in this stuff, you'll note "this product is for entertainment purposes only."

item.description: During the first phase of the game, the players roll and move on the outer part of the board, getting their trucks, coupons, and spare parts. After using the coupons to pay the "entrance fee", they begin doing a pre-determined amount of laps on the inner part of the board. The more laps that were chosen, the more spare parts that will be needed to complete the laps. There are also "good news" and "bad news" squares on the outer and inner board, which act as random events. The player who completes all the laps, or makes the most number of laps, wins. The rules book also contains more info on off-road racing and contains driver profiles on Parnelli Jones, Team MacPherson (Jerry McDonald, Jeff MacPherson, adn Joe MacPherson), John Baker, Walker Evans, Ivan Stewart, and Kjell Eriksson.

item.description:
The object of the game is to buy and sell shares in four commodities. Players draw cards that dictate the rise and fall in values and buy or sell accordingly. The skill is in observing the actions of others, predicting the trend of the market and maximizing profit.

A simple game with no upper limit to the numbers of players which is unusual. A typically compact Pepys product with a production style similar to contraband; it is a re-implementation of Win-A-Lot, which was also produced by Pepys.

From the publisher:
"PiQadilly Circus, the "Wonderful Wonderland Word Game," is alive with the spirit of Victorian whimsy. PiQadilly is both a thoughtful word game and a wild, spirited board game. This is a game that kids love to play, the perfect meeting place for adults and children. 2 to 4 players make crossword-style wordplays, then "riffle along the ruffle" in a madcap race. Word game and crossword enthusiasts will love it! (New Family Classic Game)"

From the publisher: 
"The Wizard of Menlo Park turns you into one of Thomas Edison’s enthusiastic but overworked assistants. Help Edison develop, test, and assemble the incandescent light and the electrical system that would revolutionize the world. Can you help Edison to achieve the seemingly impossible before New Year’s Eve 1879?"

From the publisher:
"The Wright Brothers has you travel the path of discovery that led to one of the greatest triumphs of technology — the invention of the airplane. If you’ve gained enough knowledge and experience, be the first to successfully fly the Wright’s airplane, the Flyer, on the sand dunes at Kitty Hawk."

For three days in July 1863, 170,000 men, all Americans, fought a climactic battle that would change the course of the American Civil War. Now you and an opponent face off in this action-packed Battle of Gettysburg simulation game. Your units do battle on a high quality mounted map which features various terrain types including streams, roads, woods, towns, railroads and stone walls in this game of "America's bloodiest battle".

YOU control your climber up the terrain of this mountain. It's over 2' tall! Special magnetic grippers that you wear on your fingers make contact with your climber's hands. Try to get to smoother paths if you can as flags mark how far you have gone. Position your climber on a hook if you need to plan you next move. But don't wait too long! After three climbs, the player who has climbed the most distance wins!

From the website (http://perfectcaptain.50megs.com/captain.html):

Miniatures rules for classical Greek warfare!
 Covers the period of the Peloponesian War through to 
the Theban War. Includes Satrapal Persian armies and 
lists for the city states of Greece, and even the Thracians!

Totally new and innovative system geared specifically for the period.

Excellent quality graphics!

This is a web-published game that is free to download and play.

Animal Twister differs from regular Twister in that there is no spinner and you use cards representing animals and limbs. The object of this game is to be first to place a hand or foot on the animal called and you win the card, who ever has the most animal cards when the cards run out is the winner. This is from Milton Bradley's "a stockin' feet game" series.

item.description: The object of the game is to score points by placing tiles so they form continuous lines. Each tile is a square with bars connecting either the opposite sides, the opposite corners, or both. The board is plastic with an 8x8 grid of circular holes, and the tiles have circular bases that fit into the holes. Each turn, a player places one of his tiles on the board and scores for any straight lines formed connecting the bars on the piece just played with the bars on adjacent pieces.

name.value: Thomas the Tank Engine & Friends Domino Game

item.description: A children's game of dominoes. The pieces are made of thick cardboard showing two engines on each card. The game can be played as a memory game similar to concentration or a simple matching game. The game helps develop memory, color and shape recognition.

item.description:
This is a "futuristic checkers" style of game, and you even get spaceships based upon very familiar themes, shows, or genres that are very easy to recognize. The acrylic gameboard is 3-sided with triangular areas depicted upon this allowing for a third player to be introduced if so desired. You also get to choose which two kinds of spaceships you'd like for this, from a selection of over a dozen available types.

In the box: 
Acrylic gameboard
Rules
2-sets of metal-cast polished pewter spaceships
A cloth storage bag for those pieces

You have to order an additional set of the spaceships if you want to play a 3-Player game.

A partnership trick taking game that consists of two phases:

In the first phase players bid for "Control Cards" that will give them a special action in the second phase. Bidding is done with face up cards that the high bidder then distributes to the other players when he takes the Control Card.

Phase two is a trick taking game in which players may play the Control Cards to a trick to affect its outcome.

Some of the cards have 1 or 2 stars on them. The score for the hand is the number of tricks taken times the number of stars won.

From the box:
You never thought that collecting nuts would be so addictive! Play as a partnership or play head to head as you attempt to be the squirrel in control.

Be careful though in order to gain control you have to give control. Experience the excitement as you exert your control, gather nuts and become top squirrel.

Warning: With enough play you may become a Control Nut too!

item.description:
from the publisher website:
Hands up!“ the bank robbers shout as they ride at full gallop into the western town. This quiet little town has never seen so much action as the sheriff gets a posse together to chase after the robbers. Is it the man with the beard or perhaps the one with the red scarf? The player who recognizes the robber in the wanted poster first, receives a deputy badge. He can only be made sheriff if he manages to catch more than one robber. Contents: 24 cards, 1 picture frame, 1 sheriff’s star, 5 deputy stars, instructions

item.description:
Doppia Coppia appears to be a game in a series, TuttiGiochi, published by Dal Negro. The 1987 F. X. Schmid copyright implies it may have been publisehd by that company too. Other games in the TuttiGiochi series (listed in the rules leaflet) are 'Micio-Gatto', 'Gioco Dei Nomi', 'Roulette Scozzese', 'La Torre Di Babele' and 'Sole, Luna E Stelle'.

Doppia Coppia means 'two pairs' in Italian, and reflects the objective of the game - to form a square using two pairs of pieces in two different colours. This simple abstract game for two players consists of a 5-by-5 square board, 5 red pieces and 5 yellow pieces. Pieces of the same colour start in a row at opposite ends of the board and players take turns to move a piece of their colour one square at a time orthogonally. A piece may also jump over one other piece as a move. The central square on the board is occupied by a four-leaf clover and pieces may not enter this square nor jump over it. A player wins when he or she makes a move that completes a square (I interpret this to be a 2-by-2 square) containing 2 red and 2 yellow pieces (the two colours may be side-by-side or crossing diagonally).

Use the money of old England to buy, sell and trade with each other. "Buy My Wares?" cards make every sale a different one.

Build the largest mon-o-polies of street pedlars and tradespeople. Beware, you can lose pedlars in many situations and there are many pitfalls for the careless!

Money will come and go, and for those who find themselves with none, arrest and Debtor's Prison are only a step away.

Catchpenny includes a game board, 6 pawns, two dice, 40 Street Pedlar cards, 12 State Lottery tickets, 11 Arrest Warrant cards, 36 Dame Fortune's Tricks cards, 36 Buy My Wares? cards, the Bailiff playing piece and 144 coins representing Crowns, Shillings, Sixpence and Pence, and 8-page Rules booklet.

"This is an entertaining card game of strategy and chance based on WWII naval combat, when fleets combined the awesome firepower of traditional battleships with long-range bombing strikes from aircraft carriers. Players determine when and how to seek combat; to use daylight for smashing carrier air strikes through defending fighters and dense anti-aircraft fire or to use the dark of night for quick and devastating surface attacks using the battleships' big guns. Submarines, destroyers, mines and torpedo boats also all play their roles."

Two to Four players command squadrons of battleships and aircraft carriers and the side that scores the most victory points by sinking enemy vessels and winning sorties wins the game.

Variations in ship attack, capability, and defense values are represented by using different types and numbers of dice.

Out of the Box calls it "The Game Where Movie Fans Connect!"

"Can you name a film taking place over the holidays AND features a character in a uniform? Then Cineplexity may be the movie game for you!" Players try to be the first to name a movie that meets the criteria on two different Cineplexity cards.

Each of the 315 cards has a description from one of nine categories: Actors, Characters, Critiques, Genre, Production, Props, Scenes, Setting and Theme. Two cards are shown at a time. Who will be the first to think of a movie set In the Future that Contains Foreshadowing? If you come up with a name that players agree satisfies both cards, you win the oldest of the two cards, and a new card is added. So now the challenge might be to find a title that Contains Foreshadowing and has a Dance Sequence. And so on. If everyone is stumped you add a third card, and they must find a title that satisfies two of the three cards. Six to ten points (cards) are needed to win, depending on the number of players.

name.value: Robot Rampage: Rise of the Appliance

item.description:
This is the first non-RPG game from 3am Games, a new company whose first release was in June 2004. "Robot Rampage: Rise of the Appliance," a beer-and-pretzels style card game, is due out in June, 2005.

From the back of the box:

You're tinkers and engineers who have come to the scrap yard to test your mettle. From parts and pieces carefully picked from heaps of junk, construct killer robots capable of visiting devastation and ruin upon all who oppose them. Then, send them into a no-holds-barred, anything goes bot battle to see who's got the roughest robot in the scrap yard! Well, maybe these bots aren't that threatening. But it's still fun to let 'em duke it out!

Monkey Arena is a fast-paced, monkey combat board game from 3am Games. From the back of the box:

Eight monkeys enter, one monkey leaves! The incompetent zoo keeper has left the zoo cages unlocked, leaving the residents to do as they please. The primates have gathered in the monkey cage to see who’s the toughest monkey around. Anything goes in this hair-pulling, rock-throwing, no-holds-barred cage match. Sticks, slaps, rakes, and pokes are the means by which the alpha male will emerge from the melee. Pick a monkey, enter the ring, and let the rumble begin in this wacky game of simian combat.

Based on the popular Dr Who baddies "War of the Daleks" is a kind of sci-fi Space-Ludo with Daleks!

The game involves moving card Dr Who figures around a circular playing area aiming to get to the "control center" whilst avoiding the Daleks. The Daleks themselves are faithful plastic renditions about three quarters of an inch tall, inserted into concentric slots cut into the board. When the pale blue "control centre" hub in the middle of the board is rotated, the card disc underpinning these concentric slots also rotate, causing the Daleks to move around the board and "capture" hapless players.

If a player makes it to the central hub, they have a chance to destroy the control centre by lifting it up. Doing so reveals four panels one of which depicts the "King Dalek." If he's next to you he exterminates you and you start again!

Each player draws a card to determine their playing colour, which remains secret during the game. The players try to distribute 40 pawns in four colours in such a way that each field on the board (8x5) will be occupied only by one single pawn. The eight rows will be scored at the end of the game. Players reveal the colour and receive victory points for having the most pawns in their colour per row. The player with the most victory points wins the game.

Edition Spielbox No. 57

In ‘Conquest for Morundir’ two players fight it out on a hex-tiled game board and steer their pawns (three dukes and six knights) to victory. First player to conquer castle Morundir (the hex field in the middle of the board) with one of their dukes or to eliminate the other player’s three dukes wins the game.

The first animal in space was a dog. True or False? The sun is a star. True or False? Learning about our solar system is much more than memorizing planets! It’s full of fascinating facts. Earn planet cards for correct answers. Put the planets in the right order, and you win! 
 
 Blast off into a learning journey through space! Be the first to collect all the planets in the solar system by answering the True/False question cards. Watch out for the black hole, asteroid belt and supernova - you might get lost in space!

* Teaches fascinating facts about our solar system 
 * Planet Fact Sheet Included 
 * Includes two challenging levels of game play 
 
 Contents: 
 Planet Quest Board Game - unfolds to 48" across! 
 4 Astronaut Game Pieces 
 Spinner 
 Guide 
 132 Game Cards 
 Planet Facts

‘Luck, Wit and Gemstones’ is a tile placement game. The tiles are divided into simple geometric shapes in four different colors, red, green, blue and yellow. Many tiles will also show one or two gemstones. Players place tiles and build complete chamber-like structures in their respective colors and try at the same time to maximize the number of gems that are enclosed in the chambers. Person with the most gemstones in closed, finished chambers of their color wins the game.

item.description: The Titanic Trivia Board game includes 1000 questions tastefully presented in four levels: Novice, Cruiser, Buff and Historian. Players will be asked critical facts about the building of the ship, the ship's decor, the journey, the crew, the tragedy, and the aftermath. Participants from the casual movie viewer to the hard core historian will thoroughly enjoy this exciting game.

Play the game that builds, boosts and bolsters Self-Esteem! You'll start your journey under a cloud in Mopesville and make your way toward feeling good good good about yourself! You'll get brainwashed with positive affirmations and learn to cope with problems along the way. Whether or not you're the first to finish, you'll get a lot of out of playing The Game Where Everybody's a Winner!

Take a wild trek Onto the Desert. Play this exciting interactive game of survival and become a part of the intricate web of desert life. Beautifully illustrated cards represent plants and animals that are found in the desert. Element cards represent the powerful forces of nature. 
Reveal the awesome balance of nature as you follow the chain of life found in the desert.

item.description:
From the Publisher's site:

Take on the role of a chivalrous paladin or a wise shaman, a holy priest or a vile warlock, a mighty mage or a crafty rogue. Play as a savage orc, a mighty tauren, a tribal troll, or one of the Forsaken undead; become an ingenious gnome, a doughty dwarf, a mysterious Night Elf, or a noble human.

Based on the popular World of Warcraft Massively Multiplayer Online Game from Blizzard Entertainment, World of Warcraft: the Board Game invites the players to choose from 16 characters, drawn from the eight races and nine character classes of the Warcraft universe, and take up arms for the glory of the Horde ... or the Alliance. Travel across Lordaeron, vanquish monsters, gain experience and power, and earn honor for your faction.

World of Warcraft: the Board Game is a team-based fantasy adventure. The Horde and the Alliance factions must compete to be the first to defeat the invincible Overlord – be it the lich Kel'Thuzad, the dragon Nefarian, or the demon Kazzak – or, failing that, to be the last faction standing when it comes to all-out war!

name.value: Η Κατάβαση: Περιπέτειες στα Έγκατα της Γης

item.description:
Descent: Journeys in the Dark is a semi-cooperative game in which two to five players will take on the antagonistic roles of heroes and Overlord. Up to four players will choose characters with a wide assortment of skills and innate abilities to be the heroes who will explore dungeons in search of treasure and adventure. One player will take on the role of the Overlord and will control the dungeon's many traps, puzzles, and monsters.

The heroes' goal will be to cooperatively conquer the dungeon, seize its many treasures, and achieve other objectives as set by the scenario. If the heroes cooperate and achieve their goals, they will all win. The Overlord's objective is simply to use all the means at his or her disposal - from deadly traps and ferocious monsters - to kill the heroes. Each hero has a certain Conquest Point value to the party and if too many Conquest Points are lost through hero death, the party loses and the Overlord wins.

Re-implemented by:

 Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition) (2012)

Descent / Runebound / Runewars Figure: Nara The Fang
Descent / Runebound / Runewars Figure: Tobin Farslayer
Descent / Runebound / Runewars Figure: Truthseer Kel
Descent: Journeys in the Dark – Quest Compendium – Volume One
Realms of Terrinoth: Descent / Runewars Scenarios
Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition)

item.description:
Players start from San Francisco on an around the world trading trip. By buying and selling wisely at various ports around the world players may make a profitable voyage.

Players start with 10,000 in cash which is used to invest in various goods that are available at different ports along the way.

First player to get to New York gets a bonus payoff for being the fastest finisher.

Whoever makes the most money on the trip wins the game

The game itself is simple. 16 tiles are played from a pool of tiles. The player unable to play a tile loses. There are several rules about playing a tile, but it is basically like dominoes.

The 16 tiles each are laid out with a 3x3 grid which can or can not have a pip in each spot in the grid, but the center spot never has a pip in it. There are none to eight pips along the edges of the tiles.

Join aspiring duelist Shobu and his friends in this special Monopoly edition. All your favorite characters and creatures are included as you move around the board to build up your Duel Masters deck. Collect creatures and spells from all of the five civilizations to become the best duelist in the game!

You can play the standard Monopoly game, buying and selling creatures and properties, or you can add the special gameplay to make this adventure even more exciting.

Contents:
· 6 Collectible Duel Masters Tokens! Shobu, Mimi, Knight, Hakuoh, Kyoshiro, Rekuta
· Gameboard
· 28 Title Deed cards
· 16 Creatures cards
· 16 Spells cards
· 6 Duel Masters character tokens
· 1 pack of Duel Masters Monopoly money
· 32 houses
· 12 hotels
· 2 standard dice
· Instructions

Duel Masters Stratego is an advanced version of Stratego set in the famous Anime setting. Unlike most classic game re-themes, Duel Masters Stratego introduces rules changes that allow the game to stand on its own.

From the game's box:

When the forces face off- who will survive?

It's a face off between all of the five forces! When Light, Nature and Water take on the fearless armies of Darkness and Fire- which team will capture the enemy's flag.

Like the Kaijudo Masters themselves, STRATEGO puts you in command of armored vehicles and ruthless creatures. Mark your territory and advance your forces on the gameboard.

The Game of Bombardment recreates naval battle during the Spanish-American War. It is played with either 2 players, or four players in partnership. A spinner is used to determine bombardment values, and play continues until one fleet or the other is sunk.

Contents: spinner, 10 markers in each color, rules printed on game box lid, and a lovely illustration of shore-cannons engaging a naval fleet.

From the promotional blurb:

"Wealth and power beyond your wildest dreams are yours...by building a fortune in companies and cash. Outwit and out bluff other players when you secretly bid to takeover their companies. Top secret information and late-breaking news add to the excitement."

Contents:
board, 2 dice, 6 player tokens, spinner, bid forms, play money, rules, stock cards, and event cards.

Turn or Burn is a print-and-play game of space fighter combat for 2 to 8 players. To start a game, players design their fighters from a deck of system cards. Each turn, players plot a single action by playing a system or maneuver card face down. After everyone has played a card, the actions are revealed. Movement is governed by Newtonian mechanics in 2 dimensions. Combat is resolved by pulling cards from a hand made up of the target fighter’s system cards plus a number of “miss” cards based on range and other factors.

A Family game for 2-6 players themed loosely around the TV Series Whickers World.

Components:

Gameboard
250 Question Cards (2000 questions)
Dice
Counters
Rules

Players move round the board through a combination of dice throws and answering questions from the cards.

During his turn a player earns the right to move any of his or her four counters by correctly answering the first question (of 6) on a card - this question normally refers to a picture on the reverse of the card.

The distance moved is determined by dice roll - this roll also being used to determine the number of the next question to be answered (from the same card). If the player answers the question correctly they may roll the dice again and have another question asked (from the same card). Play continues in this manner until a question is answered incorrectly or the same number is rolled twice on that particular card. It is then the next player's turn.

Movement is also influenced by certain of the cards and instructions written on the board.

There is also an element of tactical play in that landing one of your counters on the same square as another player's counter you send that counter back to that player's start point.

The winner is the first player to take all of their four counters around the world (the board) from their start to their finish point.

Mago Magino editions: The evil Witch has taken all crystals from the Wizard Mago Magino. The children have to help him to collect the crystals. But the witch (in the form of a witch-like spinner) can still transform the children into small frogs. So beware.



 Sunshine Rescue: Children rescue pieces of sunshine and the sun rescues the children!


Children skip through the field or take the rainbow shortcut to try and rescue pieces of sunshine. Watch out as the storm cloud spins, if it points at a child they must hide under their umbrella until the sun can rescue them. The first player who brings back three pieces of sunshine wins the game.

item.description:
Suez to Golan is a very detailed simulation of tactical combat during the October War of 1973. In addition to being published separately, the game was also published as one half of the two game package Mech War 2 (Red Star/White Star II is the other half of the set.)

Key aspects of Suez to Golan include: The issuance of commands to companies, movement in both column and dispersed formations, infantry fatigue and resting, direct fire (by automatic weapons, main guns, and ATGMs), close assault, indirect fire, morale, minefields, aircraft and air defense, ammunition depletion, effects of night, river crossings, engineers, and electronic warfare.

The Arab and Israeli units are mostly platoons. Each hex is 200 meters across and each game-turn represents five minutes.

The game has 800 counters and two mapsheets. One map depicts the Suez Canal and environs, and the other depicts a region in the Golan Heights.

There are thirteen scenarios in Suez to Golan. A comprehensive guide to scenario design is also included.


 Components :


Map: 22" x 34" single sheet
Counters: 800 pieces
Rulebook: 1 standard; 1 exclusive


 Stats :


Average Playing Time: 3-25 hours 
Number of Players: Two-? Player
Complexity: High
Suitability for Solitaire Play: Moderate

The box cover invites you to "Turn your Mind to the Challenge".

A four-in-a-row variant where the board is made of concentric rings that can be rotated. Players place one peg at a time into empty spots and then use that peg to rotate the ring.

The game comes with "standard" and "advanced" rules; the advanced rules allow players to capture pairs of opponent's pegs. In either set of rules, the first to get four of their pegs in a radial row wins.

WINNER -- 2006 Origins Award for "Historical Miniatures Game of the Year"

Using 25mm miniatures and some dice, Gutshot is a fast-paced, easy-to-learn game that has you slappin’ leather and blowin’ away the bad guys in a matter of minutes. At its core is a simple system for running one-on-one and small-scale combat set in the American Wild West. It is a fun game that is easy to learn and play; it combines realism, pulp fiction, and a little bit of “Hollywood” thrown in for good measure. Gutshot is a game that captures the spirit and mystique of the American Wild West as portrayed in movies, television, pulp novels, and comic books. It’s the American Wild West of youth and fantasy, not a detailed recreation of history. [from the website]

item.description: He who laughs last, laughs best. The board of this roll and move game is made of cards with number values from -10 to +8. The last piece to leave each card (each player has several pieces) must take the card. In the end, the player with most points (or least negative points) wins the game. The game has very few rules and lots of luck.

item.description:
A fast paced, Bible based, outrageously fun game! Babble!™ is an exciting new Bible game with a fresh style of play. Every player draws two cards and start calling out the words on the cards. Wait, did someone else just yell out "cross"? Yes! A match! Both players place their matching cards together. One player grabs a die and rolls it while the other player calls out "odd" or "even". If the guessing player guesses right, that player gets the match! If not, the player rolling the die gets the match. Each match is worth one point. The players then draw a new card and start calling out words again. Its so simple!
 The game contains six decks of cards with each deck being a different category. The six Categories are Symbols, Books, Places, People, Animals, and Things found in the Bible. Each card has five words related to that category. After playing through all six decks the player with the most points wins the game!
 Babble!™ is a terrific game for a large number of players. It is great to play with friends, family, and church groups!

This is a game of small unit actions set in the near future. Designed for quickly and simply introducing new players to table top miniature battles. D6 based with simple armor and weapons charts and straight forward combat resolution. The game was designed around Lance & Laser's miniature range of the same name.
 
 http://www.teamfrog.com/fig-sc.htm

A fast playing 25mm table top fantasy battle system. Though any number can play it's best to keep the combatants to no more than four players. An alternate movement system generates unique tactical situations during the course of a turn and allows intelligent strategists to act and react according to plans they set in motion.

Players select a race to field and the appropriate miniatures and design each scenario on a points-based army build system. D20's are used to resolve all combat and other effects. The game comes with photo copyable templates, rosters and counters.

Pepper: a whole new ball game! This "innovative new card game that sends the action in all directions! Throw a ball to anyone’s territory and see if they have what it takes to respond. Find players that can’t handle your throws and win!"

Part of Out of the Box's "Fun to Go" series, the 52 card Pepper game consists a small tin of ten cards of five colors: blue, green, orange, purple, and yellow. Each color set contains two cards of each number: 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5. Blue and yellow also have one card numbered 6.

Each player is dealt 5 cards and the rest of the cards are not used in the game. The cards represent balls being thrown from player to player, with the card's number showing its speed. The dealer places one face-up card in front of another player. That player then places one of their cards in front of another player. They may choose a higher-numbered card or a card of the same color from their hand. Alternatively, they may pick up all the cards in front of them, add them to their hand, then choose to play any of the cards in their hand. The winner is the first player to play the last card from their hand to a player who is unable to play.

from site:

"The greatest builders of ancient Rome are competing for the favor of the Emperor. Score points by building the biggest, tallest and widest buildings before the building stops. Cleverly out-build the others and all of Rome will be at your feet!"

You Be The Judge - The game of Real Life Court Dramas.

You be the Judge contains brief descriptions of 500 court cases from around the world.

Players divide themselves into two teams and take it in turns to decide on the outcome of a court case.

One person from Team A selects a card from the box and reads it out loud to Team B, who then have the opportunity to consult with each other before announcing whether they, the jury, are FOR or AGAINST. If they answer correctly then they advance 0, 1, 2, 3 places round the scoreboard, dependant on the number thrown on a dice. If they answer incorrectly, their turn ends immediately.

Team B now reads a case to Team A, who in turn, deliberate and announce their findings . And so on...

The game ends after one Team has completed a circuit of the board (16 spaces).

item.description:
18GM is an 18xx game development kit. It features a modular board that allows virtually endless scenarios to be developed. The game as printed includes one basic scenario, the Aurora Limited, and several variations on it.

Some of the interesting ideas in 18GM are:

1. Tycoons. These are like private companies in standard 18xx, but allow various special abilities in the stock round, such as exceeding certificate limits or exchanging for shares in the bank pool or initial offering.

2. Buying on Margin: buying a share by paying half now, and half during the next stock round.

3. Making a Market: the president may reduce the price of the Initial Offering shares if the company remains unfloated.

item.description: This is the Auburn University themed version of Monopoly. Unique properties include Toomer's Corner, Jordan Hare Stadium, and Samford Hall. Houses and Hotels are replaced by Credit Hours and Diplomas.

link.value: Late for the Sky Production Company

item.description: This is a Monopoly game using locals in London, England. The game uses pounds (£) instead of dollars ($). The board is identical, only the names have changed. The Chance and Community Chest cards are brighter and more colorful than a standard Monopoly set. Also the box has a nice insert designed to hold both the money (the bank) and the unpurchased properties.

item.description:
Arne Junior is the simplified version of Arne classic. The game is playable from the age of 5 and takes about 10-25 minutes to play. artwork on the cards is based on aquarelle hand painting.

pick a fruit. The one to collect most fruits of his color wins. but...you really can do everything to prevent the other players of obtaining exactly this.
You can steal cards, change places, pass on your hand to the next player and play before it is your turn. Also there are big hungry birds flying around on the look out for fruit!

Arne is available in a designer metal tin with instructions in English, German, French and Dutch.

From the Publisher:

Young children learn to make change up to a dollar and recognize combinations of pennies, nickels dimes and quarters. For example: 3 nickels and 1 dime equal 1 quarter. The game is fun and competitive as players try to get around the board to their goal at the center of the board.

From the Publisher:

The UDDERLY INCREDIBULL CARD GAME! Pass and stack your cow cards, count the holes in the Holey Cows and guess whether you have the most or the fewest holes. To win, count up your points and be the first cow to cross the pasture.
Features the pictures of the world renowned CowParade cows!

From the Publisher:

"Start your engines!" It's time for the Coolsville 500-the coolest, fastest race in town. Earn MPH cards that help speed you around the track, but be careful: the Monsters are in the pits! The first player to complete 5 laps wins.

From the Publisher:

If you can count to ten you can count on Scooby-Doo to show up when least expected! Play your cards to add, subtract, multiply and divide. Be the first to use all of your cards, you win!

From the Publishers:

Introduce problem solving challenges that occur in everyday life around the home. Math drill includes basic addition and subtraction of time, temperature, money, metrics, and liquid measurement. For example: Large eggs weigh about two ounces. How many ounces will one dozen eggs weigh?

From the Publisher:

Players will have fun with this problem solving activity as they encounter real-life situations that happen on trips. For example: calculating miles per gallon, hours on the road, and costs incurred during a trip.

From the Publisher:

Here's a great, competitive, fun-filled game. Each player chooses a colored pawn and follows the track around the board by spinning and moving to a specific number in either the ones, tens, or hundreds place. The winner is decided by the first player who makes it once around the board and follows their colored alley to the center of the board.

item.description:
From the Publisher:

Can you balance your checking account? Players learn a variety of processes involved in having a checking account. As they play around the gameboard, they write checks, make deposits, and keep accurate records. Real-life transactions include buying groceries, paying taxes, making car payments and paying medical bills. Checks, deposit slips, and currency from $1 to $100 are included.

From the Publisher:

Allowance provides a great way to teach young people about earning and saving money, as well as wisely making special purchases. Game cards indicate a task like mowing lawns and cleaning the garage. Choices are made, as in real life, whether to spend money on ice cream, or put it into savings. Coin chips from one cent to fifty cents and currency from $1 to $5 are included.

From the Publisher:

Here is a unique activity that incorporates basic math drill, using addition and subtraction facts with the growth and development of a bean! Players solve problems correctly and use markers to cover various plant parts including the root, seed, shoot, stem, leaves, and flower. Using addition facts through 9+9 and subtraction facts through 10-10 players become familiar with parts of plants while mastering addition and subtraction facts. The player who covers all sections of his or her plant wins!

From the Publisher:

Here's a great game that introduces map reading skills and following directions. Players mover around the gameboard and answer questions and set up "road blocks" to stop their opponents. Play money is included and when you reach your destination you receive $5. The first player to accumulate $30 wins!

From the Kidult website:

Gasp! What’s up? A group of pretty animals have lost their colours, will you help them come back out? And why don’t you invite your friends and play all together to see who is the fast colourer of the world?

Each kid chooses an animal to colour up and lays it on the table in front of himself. At his turn each kid throws a dice and colours up that part of the animal which is marked by the number on the dice. If that number corresponds to a coloured portion he waits for his next turn and it’s up to the child next. The winner is the one who colours up all of his animal first.

From the Kidult website:

Fotocaccia is a visual memory game. In a few seconds you have to memorize the opponents’ pets and here starts the Fotocaccia. Enrich your treasure as much as you can.
The winner is the one who manages to click more animals (that is to catch them with photo clicks). An easy and quick game for Kidults and kids. But be careful, children are terrific at this game!

From the Kidult website:

KokkoKid is a very easy game with some surprises in store!

4 hungry fearsome crocodiles go about in a lagoon that separates the stormy river from the lake of tranquility.

The hunting has began, but our crocodiles are not very smart...that's right, they are only able to go straight and imagine this, they do not know how to stop... to do this they must go to the opposite side. Now it is your turn. Will you be able to help your little fish arrive to their destination safely with your die, some cunningness and a touch of luck? The player that will save the most fishes wins.

From the Kidult website:

Who knows which colour dinosaurs were? Nobody! So have fun and colour them as you wish! Dear children, dear parents, who is writing these words has designed the animals you see, he is the father of three wonderful daughters Alessia, Alice and Michela who, like all the other children, are always searching for something new to do and to learn from. These unpublished images and these games are inspired at Bookgames a series of books designed to help parents grow with their children in a more simple way, more profitable and fun: PLAYING WITH THEM.

These games aim at those children that, in most cases, can not read yet or they are learning. That is why every character on a coloured pedestal has a big initial and a name completely written with capital letters. Children love to play: that is why every picture to be cut can become a playing card, or it can be folded along the base so that it stands and be played with.

The Kromosauri game includes 54 pictures to cut, one coloured series of (27), one black and white series of (27) (that you can colour yourself) and a series of (27) presentation cards with a brief story where the character presents himself. There are also the rules to 6 different games to able you to use the picture cards you have cut.

Thanks to this material you could have fun with your children getting them involved (and getting yourself involved) by playing with one of the 6 games offered (or you could make up new ones)

Laserburn is a set of science fiction skirmish rules, with roughly 12 to 20 figures a side. It originated as rules for simulating firefights in science fiction role playing games, but soon grew into a set of stand-alone skirmish rules.

Laserburn uses 15mm scale, the basic rulebook is 40 pages in length. Weapons covered are Lasers, bolters, slug gunes, grenade and missile launchers and conversion beams. Armour include flak, mesh, light, power and dreadnought armor.

A number of supplements and scenarios were published for Laserburn as well.

item.description: 1854. Three scenarios for the French (and Turkish) attack, the British attack, and the Alma Campaign. Two 34" x 22" maps. 300 double-sided die-cut counters. 75 yards per hex, 100 men per strength point. "The chief focus of the game is leadership, with each leader having a Command Rating, a Command Span, and a Combat Bonus Rating." Morale, facing, and formation built into the counters.

From the Publisher:

Two teams or players use basic addition facts to play this basketball simulation game. Using basketball terms such as "steal the ball" and "shoot from the key" , 18 different plays make this a great game for sports enthusiasts of all ages.

name.value: Attacktix Battle Figure Game: Star Wars

item.description:
One of the most innovative additions to the boys action aisle is ATTACKTIX. Launching with Star Wars: Episode III toys, ATTACKTIX is a battle figure game that combines great action figures with kinetic battling features.

Each figure comes on a base that contains all of the information that a trading card might include, such as speed, defense, point value and special powers unique to that character.

The goal of the game is simple: be the last one standing; but beyond that there are nearly unlimited strategies. To begin, kids select how many points each squad should start out with, pick their squads and put them into formation. On each turn, kids will move their figures across the table (counting distance using a patented clicking wheel in the base), and then attack with features like slashing light sabers, firing projectiles and others. When the figures are knocked over, their special powers come into play and influence the game. For example, granting another one of your figures an attack or bringing back a figure who may have been previously defeated.

This version is based on characters in the Star Wars Universe.

There are multiple themes in the Attacktix series of games.

item.description:
A game of interstellar conquest available free at http://www.angelfire.com/games2/warpspawn/Insur.html.

The map consists simply of ten worlds/planets/star systems. Each player begins with one loyal world with a Governor and a hand of 7 chits drawn from the pool. The pool consists of 10 of each type of unit (except for two of the installations, of which there are only 5 each) and 2 each of several (optional) special chits that allow the holder to execute special actions.

There are four different types of units: Personalities(in two types: Public and Espionage), Military Units and Military Installations. There are 4 kinds of Espionage personalities, from Assassins to Rebel Leaders, and 3 kinds each of Public Personalities, Military Units and Military Installations.

Each unit has a set of possible actions to choose from. A Governor's actions, for example, are: Recruit-5; Deploy (Personality, Troops)-5; Subdue Uprising-3; while an Assassin has only one available action: Kill (Public Personality)-3. The number following each action indicates the chances out of six that the attempted action will be successful. Recruit allows you to draw a chit from the pool into your hand, while Deploy allows you to place a unit from your hand into play. Loyal worlds have a list of actions just as units do: Recruit-5; Deploy Base-4; Deploy Personality-4; Repair-2.

During the movement phase, a unit may move from its current world to any other world on the map. Military installations may not move. Troops cannot move on their own, but must be transported by Star Cruisers. Star Cruisers may be ordered to blockade a world; any enemy personality moving to a blockaded world risks being destroyed by the blockading cruiser.

Victory is achieved by gaining the loyalty of all ten worlds or by eliminating all enemy units from the map.

Players compete to be the first to reach 100 "pumpkins" by doing the most unusual tasks: saying a word to other players with a mouth full with water, drawing with a soft pencil, and so on. Fun for grownup children Ages 14 and up

FRAGRANCES, The Perfect Blend of Art, Perfume and Game, put out by SentoSphere, Paris, France, in 1990. Description: An amusing original family game about perfume. 2-6 players. Age 12 and up. Contents: 24 scent bottles of essences, 5 women's perfume, 3 men's perfume, one mounted playing board, 8 perfume cards, 6 tokens, 1 die, 54 chips, 30 counters, 33 playing cards, rules. This game teaches you about perfume and its various classifications. The essences used in the game were selected from numerous essence producers to give you an idea of the wide range of materials used in the perfume industry.

Score the most points by creating the best poker hand possible using up to any 5 consecutive cards (your card and up to 4 cards adjacent to it- either vertically or horizontally) on the game board on each turn.

Similar to Sequence. You play a card from your hand and places a chip on the board. But chips doesn't "lock" the board. You can stack chips on top of each other. Stack up three of your chips and it's a crown. Two rows of 3 crowns is needed to win. Use your strategy to stop opponents and crown your chips first!
Is played by 2 or 3 single players or 4 players divided in two teams.

From the publisher: 
Chef Alfredo is caught in the middle of a food fight! Children grab their forks and fling their meatballs at the chef as he spins round and round. The first player to stick all of their meatballs on the chef wins. Have some food flinging fun... with no mess to cleanup! Game includes 12 meatballs, 4 flinging forks an 1 spinning chef.

The game is set under the gold rush boom and bust. Players build up the town during the boom and the town goes broke under the bust. 
Much of the action is centered on the donkey in the middle of the board. When a player draws a "Donkey Goes Wild!" card, it bucks its legs to knock down players' buildings. The player with the most assets when the "Gold Runs Out" card is drawn wins.

Game includes 4 characters, 13 buildings, 1 bucking donkey, property deeds, newspaper cards, money, gold nuggets, 2 dice, game board and instructions.

item.description:
From Box: Kuru, the rare giant KIWI is hungry again. He decides to visit his four favorite shops. But the Kiwi Catchers have other ideas and set out to catch the big Kiwi before he returns to the safety of his rain forest home. Watch Out Kiwi - don't get caught.
Object of the game: The winner is the player who finally catches The Kiwi OR the Kiwi who has visited all four shops and returns safely to the forest.

name.value: Exploration: The Seismic Game of Oil and Gas

item.description:
From the Rules:

"The game of Exploration is a realistic model of the daily events and excitement in an Oil & Gas Exploration Department
Players will instantly find themselves making decisions regarding where to drill, where to run seismic surveys, and how much to bid for prospective land parcels."

Game components include the Drilling Tool (a plastic oil rig with a long pin), the Seismic Tool (a plastic box with iron filings), money, player's score sheets, 4 different-colored Land Owner markers, colored pins to mark drilled wells (White= Dry, Yellow= Average, Red= Super Producers, Black= Wildcat), Crown Land Sale markers, Hazard cards, Windfall cards, and a gameboard with movable multi-stepped, multi-sized Oil Reservoirs placed inside (with magnets embedded in some of the 'super' producing regions).

"Far beyond the Milky Way, undisturbed for billions of years, lies a vast, cold cloud of molecular hydrogen, helium, and dust. Penetrating shock waves from a distant supernova or a close encounter with a passing star disrupts the cloud, setting its gases and dust in motion. Forcibly separated into numerous fragments, the gigantic cloud is transformed into an immense stellar nursery from which hundreds of bright, shining stars will emerge.

To play STELLAR JOURNEY: The Game, each player gathers "mass" to form three stars, plus "time" for each to evolve through all stages from beginning to end. The first player to complete the life cycles of all three - ending in a white dwarf, a neutron star, and a black hole - wins! Whether new to astronomy or a veteran stargazer, whether competing with family, friends, or classmates, whether young or old, STELLAR JOURNEY: The Game is certain to provide hours of wholesome fun, learning, and adventure!

STELLAR JOURNEY: The Game 
Simulates star birth from nursery to end stages 
Four levels of difficulty permitting players to compete at their own level 
No regressive plays - lose your next turn, etc. 
GAME CONTENTS:
Game board; game pieces; sixty colorful cards presenting a total of 300 questions at four levels of difficulty; and a booklet containing the rules of play, record charts, game objectives, match to the National Science Education Standards, image credits, and glossary."

Stellar Journey: The game was developed in cooperation with NASA'S Chandra X-ray Center and the Harvard-Smithsonian Center for Astrophysics, and The Wright Center for Innovative Science Education, Tufts University.

A Bible trivia game a bit different from the usual Trivial Pursuit style.

There are six questions to each answer, in decreasing difficulty (6 being the most difficult). In this game, players progress along a game track. Movement forward (or backward for incorrect answers) is determined by the level of difficulty you are attempting.

There are several types of square, which determine who may answer the question. A solo square means only the person whose marker is on the square may answer. A Free-For-All square means all players have the opportunity to answer. A Proxy square means the active player chooses another player to answer for them; the active player advances on the correct answer, but the proxy goes back if they answer incorrectly. A Blitz square allows everyone to answer as the active player reads the clues from most difficult to easiest. As soon as someone answers correctly, they and the active player move ahead the number of squares matching the level of clue that was the question was answered on.

Each players turn finishes after one move.

There are also Providence cards, which usually result in either going forward or back a number of squares.

First to reach the finish square wins.

Based on the BBC Television Series of the same name, Can't Cook, Won't Cook is a lighthearted family game for 2 to 6 players Ages 10 and up

From the box:

"They say "If you can't stand the heat then get out of the kitchen!" the same is true of this exciting, fast paced family action packed board game.
It's a race to get your ingredients for a perfect meal traveling up and down the board a few times to collect them. sounds simple...well it would hardly be based on the hit TV show, if it were that easy!!
Firstly, it's against the clock, then it's against another player, then you have to answer some "Can't Cook" or "Won't Cook" questions, oh and did we mention you could be rolling the pastry, tossing the pancake, chopping the herbs, stirring the pans...."

The objective is to move around the board in order to collect points. Points are collected as you collect ingredient tokens. The game ends when the first player has collected all 5 ingredients. Movement is determined by dice roll with each player taking turns to have one minute (a sand timer is provided) to move and accomplish as much as they can.

The spaces on the board dictate the activities to be undertaken on them. These include:
- collecting an ingredient, 
- pausing for a cup of tea (rolling until you get a 2),
- answering questions (cookery related - involving choosing your answer from a choice of four) or 
- performing an action - stir the pan, roll the pastry, chop the herbs or toss the pancake (the equipment for which is all included with the game)

Limbo - How Low Can You Go?

Components:
5 Limbo Blocks (wooden blocks (5cm x 5cm x 13cm)
1 Limbo Bar (wooden block (0.5cm x 5cm x 13cm) with Velcro pad
1 Limbo-low-nose (with Velcro pad)

The five limbo blocks are stacked on top of each other on the floor with the limbo bar on the top. Players take it in turns to wear the "Limbo-low-nose" and bend over an pick up the limbo bar with their nose. This must be achieved with only the feet in contact with the floor. Each player has three attempts - players who cannot do this, or touch the floor with any part of their body other than their feet are eliminated.

Once everyone has succeeded or been eliminated the bar is lowered by removing one of the limbo blocks so that the limbo bar is now resting on four blocks. Players now attempt at this height.

Play continues in this way, gradually reducing the height of the bar until either only one player is left or until at least two players have successfully picked up the bar from the floor. If this happens all five blocks are placed under the limbo bar again, and the exercise repeated, but this time players are only allowed to stand on one foot!

DELTA FORCE - "The Game of Strategy, Confrontation and Capture. Outwit your opponent in a cunning campaign of sacrifice and counter-sacrifice."

Each player has fourteen triangular pieces numbered from 1 to 14. These are arranged in a matrix on each player's side of board.

Once placed the counters are moved forward towards the center of the board where counters from both sides come "face to face" in the "attack" position. The highest number wins each confrontation.

The winner is the player to capture the most Delta Force counters.

From the website:

"Set about 50,000 years B.C. in an age of hunter gathers, and the last of the strange large mammals, such as Woolly Mammoths, Sabre-tooth Tigers and Giant Birds, the game is a mixture of board games and wargames and was a daunting task to create. It was easy all we had to do was make it simple and quick to play, whilst still blending in a level of complexity that would keep the players interest alive. Well, I am sure that we have succeeded in doing just that. Using a mixture of Metal Miniatures, Resin Buildings and Cards and Counters, there is very little note taking and working out involved as the counters and cards remove this aspect, and the player is free to work on the most important aspect of the game strategy, and this is what the game is really about!

At the beginning of the game all the players start with the same amount of pieces and the basic idea of the game is to grow your settlement faster than the other players, buying Figures and Buildings with game tokens as you go along, hopefully avoiding Natural Disasters and other unforeseen incidents.The game can be played by 2 or 4 players and is for Ages 14 and up and is fun for families as well as boardgamers & wargamers.

A great deal of time and effort was put into the design of the game pieces, which are very detailed. The same figures are used for each different tribe, which are just painted differently. Spears & Shields are cast separately, but come with the figures that they are intended for. The rules are well printed complete with a color cover, and are packed with black & white illustrations. The game tokens are printed in color, on white card.

To sum up, this was daunting but great fum to create, and to play-test, of which there were many games. There isn't a game like it on the market that I know of, and I know that those who buy a set are going to find it an appealing and tactical game. The more you play the game the faster it becomes and the more you will find that you have learned since the last time you played it."

Currently there are 2 expansions that add Shamans and water taskings:

- "The Savage Seas" 
- "Out of the Wilderness"

For more info, check the publisher webpage:
https://www.stevebarbermodels.com

or the yahoo group: http://groups.yahoo.com/group/steve_barber_models/
